title: State of Decay
dialogue_triumphs: He who outlives this day and comes safe home shall stand a-tiptoe when this day is named and rouse him at the name of E-space!
There was once an old hermit from the mountains of South Gallifrey…
They came out of nowhere and swarmed… all over the Universe
Do you know, it just occurs to me, there are vampire legends on almost every inhabited planet?… Creatures that stalk the night and feast on the blood of the living.
goofs: The Doctor says the Tower decor is rococo when actually it's late Saxon/early Romanesque.
In episode three, a rebel bursts into the Doctor's cell, catching him across the nose with the door (Tom Baker appears slightly stunned, and misses his next cue).
Why is Kalmar so concerned to get back to Earth when he and his people have never been there?

continuity_notes.name: K-9
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's robotic companion, capable of storing vast amounts of data.
continuity_notes.current_status: Traveling with the Doctor and providing information about vampires and TARDIS procedures.

continuity_notes.name: Rassilon
continuity_notes.description: Legendary founder of Time Lord society, involved in the war against the Great Vampires.
continuity_notes.current_status: Historical figure, mentioned in relation to vampire lore.

continuity_notes.name: Great Vampires
continuity_notes.description: Ancient enemies of the Time Lords, nearly extinct except for one survivor.
continuity_notes.current_status: One survivor present on the unnamed planet in E-space.

continuity_notes.name: Hydrax
continuity_notes.description: Earth ship drawn into E-space by the Great Vampire.
continuity_notes.current_status: Used by the vampires on the unnamed planet.

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space machine, containing important historical records.
continuity_notes.current_status: In use by the Doctor and companions, containing the Record of Rassilon.

continuity_notes.name: E-space
continuity_notes.description: An alternate universe where the TARDIS is currently trapped.
continuity_notes.current_status: Current location of the Doctor and companions.

technobabble: A 'technacothaka' is said to be a museum.
Bow-ships which fired bolts of steel to kill the vampires
roots: The vampire genre (especially Hammer vampire films)
Browning's 'Childe Roland to the Dark Tower Came'
links: Full Circle (previous episode in the E-space trilogy)

locations.name: Unnamed planet in E-space
locations.description: A planet with a day equivalent to 23.3 Earth hours and a year of 350 Earth days, unchanged for thousands of years.
locations.current_status: Under the control of vampire-like beings, with a fearful population of villagers.

untold_adventures: The Time Lord war with the Great Vampires
qv: The Origins of the Time Lords
additional_notes: The episode heavily features vampire lore and connects it to Time Lord history, expanding on the mythology of the Doctor Who universe.
bottom_line: A smashing evocation of a traditional horror story, worked into the Doctor Who formula.
